children.content: Involvement of distal hands and feet, face and neck
Calcinosis, Raynaud's phenomenon, Esophageal dysmotility, Sclerodactyly, Telangiectasias
Management of Raynaud's phenomenon and skin care
Barium swallow and upper endoscopy if indicated
Additional evaluation for pulmonary hypertension (i.e. right-sided heart catheterization)
Involvement of skin proximal to hands and feet, face, neck and trunk
Morphea, Linear scleroderma, En coup de sabre
Other: eosinophilic fasciitis, scleredema, scleromyxedema, diabetic sclerodactyly, hypothyroidism, POEMS, GVHD, amyloid, NFD, bleomycin, environmental exposures
CBC, eosinophil count, thyroid-stimulating hormone, blood glucose, serum and urine protein electrophoresis
Lower GI tract evaluation if indicated
Chest x-ray, Pulmonary function test with DLCO, echocardiogram
High-resolution chest CT and consider bronchoscopy
Consider treatment of interstitial lung disease/alveolitis and/or pulmonary hypertension
